channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Charlie Kirk had a message for the over 2 million unemployed Gen Z NEET men: You don’t need college to make your dreams happen
item.description: From dropout to multimillion-dollar nonprofit leader, Kirk claimed college was overrated—and many Gen Z share his skepticism.

item.title: Trump’s tariffs are bringing in a ‘very significant’ amount of revenue, top analyst says: Roughly $350 billion a year
item.description: Fortune's Shawn Tully and Steve "the money doctor" Hanke have argued that they bear a strong, uncanny resemblance to a tax western Europe has had for ...

item.title: Disney brings back Jimmy Kimmel’s show after backlash spurred massive boycott while some conservatives blasted FCC

item.title: Google faces antitrust déjà vu as US seeks to break up its digital advertising business
item.description: Google is facing another attempt to dismantle its internet empire in a trial focused on its abusive tactics in digital advertising.

item.title: White House says Oracle would manage TikTok security for U.S. users if deal is approved
item.description: Determining next steps for the algorithm, currently owned by the Beijing-based ByteDance, has been one of the most closely watched issues during negot...
